alert.note: Alert for Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 6:29AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Whitley County through 645 AM EDT... At 628 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Jellico Creek, or near Williamsburg, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Saxton, Dixie and Nevisdale around 635 AM EDT. Lot, Red Ash, Packard, Polly Camp and Gatliff around 640 AM EDT. Wilkerson and Pearl around 645 AM EDT. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 1 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
